sentence.Network_en: There has been no discernible overall trend since 1975.
sentence.Network_cn: 自1975年以来一直没有一个明朗的大趋势。

sentence.Network_en: Night fell, but the outline of the factory buildings was still discernible.
sentence.Network_cn: 夜幕降临了, 但厂房还能看见个轮廓.

sentence.Network_en: The difference between the two is readily discernible.
sentence.Network_cn: 两者之间的差别不难看出.

entry.def: If something is discernible, you can see it or recognize that it exists.

example.ex: Far away the outline of the island is just discernible...
example.tran: 远处，岛屿轮廓仅依稀可辨。

example.ex: There has been no discernible overall trend since 1975.
example.tran: 自 1975 年以来一直没有一个明朗的大趋势。

means.word_mean: 1. perceptible by the senses or intellect;

sentences.sentence: "things happen in the earth and sky with no discernible cause"
"the newspaper reports no discernible progress in the negotiations"
"the skyline is easily discernible even at a distance of several miles"
"an essay with a meaning that was not always discernible"

means.word_mean: 3. capable of being seen or noticed;

sentences.sentence: "a clearly evident erasure in the manuscript"

auth_sentence.content: The elements of an honourable compromise are now discernible.
auth_sentence.res_content: The elements of an honourable compromise are now discernible.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The elements of an honourable compromise are now discernible.

auth_sentence.content: Breitbart says, That was my only discernible skill.
auth_sentence.res_content: Breitbart says, That was my only discernible skill.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Breitbart says, That was my only discernible skill.

auth_sentence.content: There is no discernible sign of that yet.
auth_sentence.res_content: There is no discernible sign of that yet.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There is no discernible sign of that yet.

stems_affixes.word_buile: concern[v.关系到 n.关心]+ed……的→adj.关心的, 有关的
discern[v.辨别;区分]+ible能……的→adj.能够分辨的
con共同+cern搞清,区别→共同搞清楚→关心
discern[v.辨别;区分]+ment表名词→n.辨别能力
con共同+cern搞清,区别→共同搞清楚→关心
dis分开+cern搞清,区别→分开搞清→区别

sentences.en: a discernible change in the weather
Her face was barely discernible in the gloom.
sentences.cn: 在黑暗中几乎辨认不出她的脸来。

sentences.en: The difference between the two is readily discernible.
sentences.cn: 两者之间的差别不难看出。
